page.title: 16THE DOCKS AT LOWESTOFT
page.content: The fish-docks in Lowestoft are not as busy as they were. We used to have many trawlers, but now we only have 19 as the fishing industry has declined. Many of the old trawlers have been converted to oil or gas-rig rescue or stand-by ships. We have a bascule bridge where the A12 road separates the Outer Harbour from the Inner Harbour. In the Inner Harbour ships are built, repaired, cargoes unloaded and goods stored. By the Outer Harbour there is a yacht club and the Fish Market. The port now has a container trade as we had two million pounds spent on it last year. We now get timber from northern countries besides many other imports.
